content:
What's the rule for the copyright header of a file that's been split off another one?

  • Who should we credit for the copyright?
  • Who should we credit as authors?
  • What date should we set?
Sometimes the git blame shows the entire contents of the split was added in a single commit - if so, then using the authors for that commit is probably reasonable
When in doubt, I've just duplicated the header
+1 to duplicating the header. Same authors, copyright, and date as the original
I suppose it's fine to drop an author that you know was not involved (past or present) in any of the lines being moved, but usually it's not worth the trouble
